Platform.Title: WUSTL_TIGR Listeria monocytogenes spotted 70-mer oligonucletoide array

Column.Name: ID
Column.Description: TIGR PVGRC oligo designation, with ListiList ORF designation preceeding for strain EGDe spots

Sample.Title: WT_BHI_30min_repA

Channel.Extract-Protocol: Trizol with silica beads in MP FastPrep
Channel.Label: Cy5
Channel.Label-Protocol: 5 ug amplified RNA was reaction with Cy dye for 60 min, and purified using Zymo clean and concentrate columns (see Leber et al, PloS Pathogens, 2008 for more detail)

Channel.Source: pooled reference total RNA from all samples used in this experiment (6 samples)
Channel.Extract-Protocol: Trizol with silica beads in MP FastPrep
Channel.Label: Cy3
Channel.Label-Protocol: 5 ug amplified RNA was reaction with Cy dye for 60 min, and purified using Zymo clean and concentrate columns (see Leber et al, PloS Pathogens, 2008 for more detail)

Sample.Hybridization-Protocol: applied to spotted arrays in binding buffer containing HEPES, SSC, tRNA, and SDS at 63 °C for 48 hours (see Leber et al, PloS Pathogens, 2008 for more detail)
Sample.Scan-Protocol: Images were scanned on a Molecular Devices GenePix 4100B scanner, using GenePix Pro software
Sample.Data-Processing: Background subtracted data obtained from log2 of processed Red signal/processed Green signal, using GenePix Pro software

Series.Title: Listeria monocytogenes transcriptional response to bile
Series.Summary: These studies were designed to examine the acute Listeria monocytogenes transcriptional response to mammalian (porcine) bile.
Series.Overall-Design: Triplicate WT Listeria monocytogenes (strain 10403S) were grown to mid-log in BHI at 37 °C. Samples were divided, and either treated or not treated by addition of porcine bile (Sigma, to 1% final) for 30 minutes.
